item.title: Karp-Rabin
item.description: Table Doubling, Karp-Rabin how to choose m? want m = Î˜(n) => ð›¼ = Î˜(1) Idea: start small: m = 8 grow/shrink as necessary If m > n, grow a table make table of size m' build new hash f' rehash insert them in new table T' Î˜(n+m+m') in the case above if m' = m + 1 the cost of n insert is Î˜(1+2+3+…+n) = Î˜(n2) if m' = 2m Oh, Golden cost of n insert is Î˜(1+2+4+8+…+n) = Î˜(n) Table Doubling => Amortization

item.title: Newton's Method
item.description: Square Roots, Newton’s Method Square Roots recall the sqrt(2) problem xi+1 = (xi + a/xi) / 2 Notice the division in it that’s what we’ll settle down Error Analysis of Newton’s Method xn = âˆša (1 + ð›†n) ð›†n may +/- xn+1 = ( âˆša ( 1 + ð›†nÂ ) + a / ( âˆša ( 1 + ð›†nÂ ) ) / 2 = ( âˆša ( 1 + ð›†n ) + 1 / ( 1 + ð›†n ) ) / 2
